note.p: Death: Hatton Garden, London, England, United Kingdom (21 January 1819)
Profession: Physician; chemist; plantation and slave owner

Education: Practiced medicine in Aberdeen; went to Dominica and purchased the sugar and coffee plantation 'Clark Hall' (c 1770); Member of His Majesty's Council, Dominica; practised medicine in Dominica for many years; conducted pioneering research into yellow fever during an outbreak in Dominica (1793-1797); returned to Britain (c 1810)
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; Wikipedia; UCL LBS
References: 'Dr James Clark', Legacies of British Slave-ownership database, http://wwwdepts-live.ucl.ac.uk/lbs/person/view/2146645587 (accessed 3rd July 2020)
